::Light Lavatron::

Light Lavatron looks up at the clouds, knowing from his previous 
attack that firing at Shadow Cat would be useless. Two regular 
missile launchers emerge from Lavatron's shoulders, arming themselves 
for when the enemy would reapear.

Lavatron fires as he sees Snow Tech fly out of the clouds, screaming. 
He fires a missile, but misses the Maximal. Lavatron runs toward Snow 
Tech, yelling when he feels the ice hit his left foot, freezing it in 
place. Lavatron growls, aiming his palms at Snow Tech. Lightning 
bolts fire from both his palms, tearing up the ground where they hit, 
and then heading for Snow Tech. The two missile launchers on his 
shoulders aim upward, firing two missiles into the clouds at Shadow 
Cat.




--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Alten Gould" <beastwarsaddress@h...> 
wrote:
> 
> * SHadow Cat blinked in suprise. This isn't what she had in mind. 
The most 
> she expected is that he would deflect it. Not fire it back! she 
watched as 
> the bolt came towrds her, she was not worried. Electric energy did 
her no 
> harm, she was a part of it as much as it was a part of her. But she 
did not 
> want them to know that. She placed her open hands in front of her 
and 
> "caught" the bolt as it came at her. Again she gathered it up, but 
she knew 
> it would be usless to fire it back. So, instead, she gathered it up 
and 
> stored it in her porpultion systems. She turned them on and flew 
off with 
> her extra boost of speed. She swooped down and caught SNow Tech 
around the 
> waist and again flew up into the clouds, hoping they would provide 
some 
> cover from the Pred.*
> 
> " Snow Tech, you need to use your ice beam to freeze his feet, so 
he can't 
> move. I'll see what i can do from there. Oh, and i hope you can fly"
> 
> * Shadow Cat then let go of his waist, letting him fall to earth. 
Snow Tech 
> screamed, closed his eyes and spread his wings. He didn't know how 
to fly, 
> but he could glide. He soared downward for a good five seconds 
before he 
> relized that he wasn't falling, but flying. Of sorts. He glided 
into a small 
> stand of brush, landing akwardly, but he managed to untangle 
himself before 
> anyone could notice. He krept out of the bush, and creeped up on 
the large 
> Pred. He called up all the Winter energy he could, and filed it 
into his 
> blaster. When that was done, he pointed the gun not at it's head, 
but it's 
> feet.*
> 
> " This aught to stall him for a bit!"
> 
> * And he fired a wide beam, making sure that it would hit it's feet-
up.*
> 
>
